name: Spacewar! (1962)
description: One of the earliest computer games, where two players control spaceships and attempt to shoot each other while maneuvering around a star.

name: Hamurabi (1968)
description: A resource management game where players act as rulers, managing land, population, and resources to keep their kingdom prosperous.

name: Oregon Trail (1971)
description: A simulation of the journey of 19th-century settlers traveling from Missouri to Oregon, involving decisions about supplies, routes, and health.

name: Pong (1972)
description: A simple tennis-like game where two players use paddles to hit a ball back and forth across the screen.

name: Lemonade Stand (1973)
description: A business simulation where players run a lemonade stand, making decisions about pricing, inventory, and advertising to maximize profits.

name: Star Trader (1974)
description: A trading simulation game where players buy and sell goods across different star systems, managing resources and making strategic decisions.

name: Maze War (1974)
description: An early first-person shooter game where players navigate a maze and attempt to shoot other players.

name: Dungeon (1975)
description: Also known as Zork, a text-based adventure game where players explore a dungeon, solve puzzles, and collect treasures.

name: Colossal Cave Adventure (1976)
description: One of the earliest interactive fiction games, where players explore a cave, solve puzzles, and collect treasures.

name: Breakout (1976)
description: A game where players use a paddle to bounce a ball and break bricks on the screen.

name: Adventure (1979)
description: An action-adventure game where players explore a fantasy world, collect items, and defeat enemies to win.

name: Asteroids (1979)
description: A space-themed arcade game where players control a spaceship and shoot asteroids while avoiding collisions.

name: Pac-Man (1980)
description: An arcade game where players control Pac-Man, navigating a maze to eat dots while avoiding ghosts.

name: Rogue (1980)
description: A dungeon crawling game where players navigate a procedurally generated dungeon, fighting monsters and collecting treasures.

name: Donkey Kong (1981)
description: An arcade platformer where players control Mario, climbing ladders and avoiding obstacles to rescue a princess from Donkey Kong.

name: Frogger (1981)
description: An arcade game where players guide a frog across a busy road and a river, avoiding obstacles to reach safety.

name: Defender (1981)
description: A side-scrolling shooter where players control a spaceship, defending humanoids from alien abductors.

name: Galaga (1981)
description: A space shooter game where players control a spaceship, shooting waves of incoming aliens.

name: Lode Runner (1983)
description: A puzzle platformer where players collect gold while avoiding guards and using ladders and ropes to navigate levels.

name: Tetris (1984)
description: A tile-matching puzzle game where players rotate and place falling blocks to complete and clear lines.
